meanings.definition: To take a wrong step or make a mistake in movement.
meanings.sent1: She misstepped and almost fell on the slippery floor.
meanings.sent2: He misstepped while dancing but quickly regained his balance.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy cat misstepped and ended up in a funny pose.
meanings.sent4: In the race of life, one misstep can lead you off course.
meanings.sent5: The hiker misstepped on the rocky trail, causing a small stumble.

meanings.definition: To make an error or mistake in judgment or action.
meanings.sent1: They misstepped by trusting the wrong person with their secret.
meanings.sent2: She misstepped in her speech and unintentionally offended some listeners.
meanings.sent3: The chef misstepped and added salt instead of sugar to the cake batter.
meanings.sent4: One misstep in negotiations could cost the company a valuable contract.
meanings.sent5: He misstepped in his calculations, leading to an incorrect answer.
